organizations: TENNESSEAN El Dia de los Muertos Cheekwood
title: 10 family-friendly Halloween events in Nashville
text:
10 family-friendly Halloween events in Nashville Boo at the Zoo Formerly called Ghouls at Grassmere, the Nashville Zoo invites families to come after hours for trick-or-treating, games, bounce house, hay maze, corn pit, photos with a princess, Howl-O-Ween Hayride through the Bubble Tunnel, and Grave Matters: The Stories Behind the Stones. Dipti Vaidya, The Tennessean Pumpkinfest Franklin's annual festival returns with Church of the City's Kid Zone, costume contests for humans and pets, live performances, chili cook off, the giant Great Pumpkin and more. Mark Zaleski Hauntanel The Fontanel Mansion hosts a Haunted Hayride (for all ages), trick-or-treating, The Dead Among Us zombie walking trail (for ages 10 and up), and a scarecrow contest. Samuel M. Simpkins/The Tennessea Hauntings at The Hermitage Take a ghost tour of the mansion, Presidential Trick or Treat Trail, and a haunted hayride through The Hermitage woods. JAE S. LEE / THE TENNESSEAN El Dia de los Muertos Cheekwood celebrates the Hispanic Day of the Dead holiday with a tapete -or colorful "carpet" -contest created by local schools, ofrendas (altars) created by local organizations, live music and dances. Mark Zaleski, Mark Zaleski / For The Tennessea Haunted Museum Hear ghost stories during Haunted Museum at the Tennessee State Museum on Saturday. Local spirits will be on hand to tell ghost stories during Haunted Museum at the Tennessee State Museum on Saturday. Submitted Submitted Booville and Halloscream Addison Perry,2, dressed up as a pinata during a children costume contest at the 31st annual Pumpkinfest in downtown Franklin on Sat. Oct. 25, 2014. The 31st annual Pumpkinfest in downtown Franklin on Sat. Oct. 25, 2014. Shelley Mays Spooky Science and Chemistry Day Watch experiments with disappearing and reappearing dye and color-changing fire, a pumpkin powder keg and more at the Adventure Science Center. McIninch, Getty Images/iStockphoto Trick or Treat with the Nashville Symphony Halloween-themed concert by the Nashville Symphony, playing Hedwig's Theme from Harry Potter, Edward Grieg’s In the Hall of the Mountain King and music from Igor Stravinsky’s Firebird Suite. Pre-concert activities include crafts, story nook and instrument petting zoo. Larry McCormack/The Tennessean, The Tennessean Twisted Tennessee: Two Sides to Every Tale Tour the grounds of the historic home to hear two sides of true Tennessee stories, from child axe murderer Mary Doherty to the death of Meriwether Lewis. Larry McCormack / The Tennessean Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide Boo at the Zoo Formerly called Ghouls at Grassmere, the Nashville Zoo invites families to come after hours for trick-or-treating, games, bounce house, hay maze, corn pit, photos with a princess, Howl-O-Ween Hayride through the Bubble Tunnel, and Grave Matters: The Stories Behind the Stones. Dipti Vaidya, The Tennessean Jen Todd , jtodd1@tennessean.com 8:04 a.m. CDT October 5, 2015 Costumes are welcome in these family-friendly, Nashville-area events, including Pumpkinfest in Franklin. (Photo: Mark Zaleski) 48 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
From trick-or-treating to hayrides, costumed kids of all ages can enjoy these Nashville-area events. Boo at the Zoo, formerly Ghouls at Grassmere 
Activities: Trick-or-treating, games, bounce house, hay maze, corn pit, photos with a princess, Howl-O-Ween Hayride through the Bubble Tunnel, Grave Matters: The Stories Behind the Stones 
When: 5-9 p.m. Fridays-Sundays from Oct. 16-30, plus Oct. 29 
Where: Nashville Zoo, 9777 Nolensville Pike 
Tickets: $15, $12 for members, free for babies under 2 years old 
Details: www.nashvillezoo.org/boo , 615-833-1534 Pumpkinfest 
Activities: Church of the City's Kid Zone, costume contests for humans and pets, live performances, chili cook off, the Great Pumpkin 
When: 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Oct. 24 
Where: Main Street in Historic Downtown Franklin 
Tickets: Free 
Several Nashville-area events offer family-friendly haunted hayrides for the Halloween season. (Photo: File / The Tennessean) Hauntanel 
Activities: Haunted Hayride (for all ages), trick-or-treating, The Dead Among Us zombie walking trail (for ages 10 and up), scarecrow contest 
When: 7-11 p.m. Oct. 23-24 
Where: Fontanel Mansion, 4225 Whites Creek Pike 
Tickets: $15 
Details: www.hauntanel.com , 615-724-1600 Hauntings at the Hermitage 
Activities: Ghost tour of the mansion, Presidential Trick or Treat Trail, haunted hayride through The Hermitage woods 
When: 4-10 p.m. Oct. 24 
Where: The Hermitage, 4580 Rachel's Lane 
Tickets: $14, $9 for ages 4-12 El Dia de los Muertos at Cheekwood 
Cheekwood celebrates El Dia de los Muertos, or Day of the Dead, Oct. 24. (Photo: Mark Zaleski / For The Tennessea) 
Activities: See tapete — or colorful "carpet" — contest created by local schools, ofrendas (altars) created by local organizations, live music and dances 
When: 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Oct. 24 
Where: Cheekwood, 1200 Forrest Park Drive 
Tickets: $14, free for children 17 and under and members 
Details: www.cheekwood.org , 615-356-8000 Haunted Museum 
Activities: Ghost trail through the museum, Tennessee ghost stories, prizes, crafts, drinks, visit to see the 3,500-year-old mummy and mummified cat 
When: noon-4 p.m. Oct. 24 
Where: Tennessee State Museum, 505 Deaderick Street 
Tickets: Free 
Details: www.tnmuseum.org , 615-741-2692 Booville and Halloscream 
Activities: Booville: Hay bale maze, bounce houses, crafts, costume contest, storytelling, trick-or-treat trail, games, Tennessee's largest Frankenstein. Trail of Terror: Zombies, crazy clowns, insane scientists, and evil spirits. Haunted Hayride: Backwoods killers, freak show clowns and werewolves. 
When: Booville is noon-5 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays in October; Halloscream is 7-11 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays, 7-10 p.m. Sundays in October and Nov. 1 
Where: Nashville Shores, 4001 Bell Road 
Tickets: $15 Trail of Terror, $25 Trail of Terror and Haunted Hayride, $5.99 Booville 
Note: Costumes are allowed in Booville, but not allowed in Halloscream 
Costumes are welcome in these family-friendly, Nashville-area Halloween events. (Photo: Shelley Mays) Spooky Science & Chemistry Day 
Activities: E xperiments with disappearing and reappearing dye and color-changing fire, a pumpkin powder keg and more. 
When: 10 a.m.-3 p.m. Oct. 31 
Where: Adventure Science Museum, 800 Fort Negley Blvd. 
Tickets: $14, $11 for ages 2-12 
Details: www.adventuresci.org , 615-862-5160 Trick or Treat with the Nashville Symphony 
Activities: Halloween-themed concert by the Nashville Symphony, playing Hedwig's Theme from Harry Potter, Edward Grieg’s In the Hall of the Mountain King and music from Igor Stravinsky’s Firebird Suite. Pre-concert activities include crafts, story nook and instrument petting zoo. 
When: 11 a.m. Oct. 31 
Where: Schermerhorn Symphony Center, One Symphony Place 
Tickets: $23-$28, $14-$19 for children 17 and under 
Details: www.nashvillesymphony.org , 615-687-6400 Twisted Tennessee: Two Sides to Every Tale 
Activities: Tour of the historic home to hear two sides of true Tennessee stories, from child axe murderer Mary Doherty to the death of Meriwether Lewis. 
When: 6-10 p.m. Oct. 23 
Where: Travellers Rest, 636 Farrell Pkwy 
Tickets: $10, $5 ages 5-9, free for children 4 and under 48 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://tnne.ws/1LdGYi3 More Stories
